ACT
33
Public will if the testator is unable to read it
In the event that the testator is unable to read the will drawn up for him by an authorized person, the latter will read it to the testator in the presence of two witnesses who understand the language in which the will was drawn up, after which the testator will sign the will in their presence or put on it his hand sign , as he declares that it is his will.
The witnesses shall sign the will itself.
The authorized person will make a record of all the actions from the previous paragraph in the will document itself, which will confirm that all these actions have been taken. This record is signed by the testator, witnesses and an authorized person.
